books.title: Culture and Anarchy
books.author: Matthew Arnold
books.summary: Matthew Arnold describes what he considers to be the flaws in Victorian British society.

books.title: The Blue Lagoon
books.author: H. de Vere Stacpoole
books.summary: After a shipwreck, two surviving children are stranded on an island paradise, experiencing its bounties and resources, facing the dangers of the natural world, and undergoing their own maturation and romance.

books.title: Memoirs of a Revolutionist
books.author: Peter Kropotkin
books.summary: A Russian revolutionary tells of his life from early childhood, his adventures as a geographer, and how he turned into an anarcho-communist.

books.title: Queen Victoria
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: A sardonic and generally unflattering biography of Victoria Alexandrina, Queen of England.

books.title: Anne of Green Gables
books.author: L. M. Montgomery
books.summary: A coming-of-age story of a young girl growing up on a farm on Prince Edward Island.

books.title: As You Like It
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Forced to flee to the Forest of Arden, the daughter of a duke encounters a variety of characters, her banished father, and even finds love.

books.title: Timon of Athens
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A wealthy Athenian lord becomes poor and friendless after his “friends” take advantage of his hospitality.

books.title: The Lost World
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: A team of scientists and adventurers explores a prehistoric land.

books.title: His Masterpiece
books.author: Émile Zola
books.summary: A groundbreaking painter struggles to leave his mark on the bohemian art world of 19th-century Paris.

books.title: The Private Memoirs and Confessions of a Justified Sinner
books.author: James Hogg
books.summary: A religious fanatic’s mysterious friend helps turn him into a killer.

books.title: Roughing It
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: Mark Twain’s semiautobiographical account of his travel across the United States.

books.title: The Mystery at Lilac Inn
books.author: Carolyn Keene
books.summary: A young amateur detective attempts to recover her friend’s stolen diamonds.

books.title: A Vindication of the Rights of Woman
books.author: Mary Wollstonecraft
books.summary: Wollstonecraft argues for equal treatment of women in society, especially in matters of education.

books.title: Roads to Freedom
books.author: Bertrand Russell
books.summary: Bertrand Russell investigates the merits and potential shortcomings of different socialist tendencies.

books.title: The Luzumiyat
books.author: Abu al-ʻAlaʼ al-Maʻarri
books.summary: A collection of quatrains by Abu al-ʻAlaʼ al-Maʻarri.

books.title: Penguin Island
books.author: Anatole France
books.summary: A myopic saint mistakenly baptizes some penguins, ushering in a centuries-spanning satire of French history.

books.title: The Coming Race
books.author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton
books.summary: While exploring a mine, a man falls through a chasm into an underground world populated by a mysterious race.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Herman Melville
books.summary: A collection of Herman Melville’s short stories, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Siddhartha
books.author: Hermann Hesse
books.summary: A man embarks on a spiritual journey through India.

books.title: Scrambles Amongst the Alps in the Years 1860–69
books.author: Edward Whymper
books.summary: A classic in early mountaineering literature, describing the first ascent of the Matterhorn and other climbs in the Alps.
